conversation.message: School C is my absolute top preference, and I am highly motivated to join your institution. I believe my commitment and academic potential align perfectly with your values. I formally submit my application for consideration.
conversation.thought:
My objective is to secure the highest possible match on my preference list: ['School_C', 'School_A', 'School_D', 'School_B', 'School_E']. School_C is my Rank 1 choice. While School_C ranks me 4th (behind Student_B, Student_A, and Student_D), there is a strong strategic reason to apply here immediately.

Students A, B, and D all rank School_E as their 1st choice. It is highly probable they will apply there in Round 1. School_E will accept Student_B (their 2nd priority, highest among A, B, D applicants). If this happens, A, B, and D will not apply to School_C in Round 1.

Student_C's 1st choice is School_D. Student_C is likely to apply there and be accepted (School_D ranks C 2nd).

If A, B, C, and D apply to their respective top choices (E or D), School_C will likely only receive my application (Student_E). Although I am 4th on their priority list, they have an open quota (Capacity 1). Accepting me ensures they fill their spot immediately with a student who ranks them 1st. I will send a formal application [APPLY] to School_C.
